723787f-a.text:
30-28, 26 and 24-2O Vesey Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Church Street, as seen across St. Paul's Church Yard. No. 30-28 is the Underwood Building and No. 24-20 the Evening Post Building (the Post is now, 1937,at 75 West Street). At the extreme left is visible a portion of the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line on Church Street.
October 10, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
723787f-a.folder: Vesey Street & Church Street, Manhattan, NY

723789f-c.text:
4o, 42 and 44, and 46 Vesey Street, north side,west of Church Street, showing three consecutive views of the store fronts and the various types of merchandise displayed. The entire block of houses, of which these were a part has been demolished; upon this site now (1937) stands a U. 8. Post
0ffice. These views were taken at the same time.
July 26, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
723789f-c.folder: Vesey Street & Church Street, Manhattan, NY

723791f-a.text:
49 Vesey Street, south side, between Church and Greenwich Streets, showing a 3-story house, the upper floors of which are occupied by an
atheist publication called The Truth Seeker.
August 1, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
723791f-a.folder: Vesey Street & Church Street, Manhattan, NY

723784f-a.text:
(1)
Vesey Street, north side, west from Church, to and including West Streets, showing demolition of houses between Church Street and West Broadway, to be replaced by the United States Post Office. Also shown (foreground) is a portion of the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line on Church Street, and in the background, a portion of the Ninth Ave. Elevated Line on Greenwich Street. Across it is seen the New York Telephone Building
at No. 140 West Street.
April TCTaae. 'g,
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date, showing demolition at a more advanced stage.
October 1, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A limited view of the demolition between Church Street and West Broadway.
October 1, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
723784f-a.folder: Vesey Street & Church Street, Manhattan, NY

718860f-a.text:
(1)
Church Street, east side, south from but not including Barclay, to, but not including Fulton Streets, as seen through clearance for the United States Post Office. The Sixth Ave., Elevated is shown on Church Sereet. Also shown is St. Paul's Protestant
Episcopal Chapel.
March 13, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a different angle and showing Vesey Street, south side, east from but not including Greewich, to ahd including Church Streets. Also shown is Fulton S,reet,(south side of St. Paul's church yard), south side, easf from but not including Church Street, to and including Broadway.
March 13, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

730367f-a.title: General view - [Manhattan - Church Street - Vesey Street.]
730367f-a.text:
A general view westward from the Underwood Building, at the N.E. corner of Church and Vesey Streets, showing the 29-story New York Telephone Building on Washington Street, from Vesey (left), to Barclay (right) Streets and extending to West Street. Construction work shown, in the foreground, is on the east side of West Broadway, for a new U.S. Post Office. Also shown is the Ninth Ave. Elevated line running on Greenwich Street, with the Hudson River and the New Jersey shore in the background.
March 27, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
730367f-a.folder: Church Street - Vesey Street., Manhattan, NY

1557885.title: 90 Church Street - Vesey Street
1557885.folder: 90 Church Street - Vesey Street, Manhattan, NY

718854f-c.text:
(1)
Church Street, west side, north from and including Vesey Street, showing a portion of the 6th Avenue Elevated Line upon same. Also shown is construction in progress for the Independent Subway; excavation for same shown in the foreground being at the S. W. corner of Vesey Street.
October 11, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date, showing subway construction at a more
advanced stage.
July 26, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same as No. 1, from a different angle and showing a more extensive
view. Note the Elevated Station at Park Place.
June 11, 1929.
56E E,2TEE;7 2RR.

723779f-a.text:
Vesey Street, east from Church Street to Park Row, showing prominently the Underwood Building (No. 73-7 Church Street). This is silhouetted against (from left to right) the Woolworth, Transportation, Park Row and St. Paul Buildings. At the right is a portion of St. Paul's Church Yard and at the left, the
rear of St. Peters R. C. Church.
View 2 is an earlier photo of a portion of the preceding view. Note several of the aforementioned structures. At the
left is the southerly side of the Astor House.
April 3, 1934
P. L. Sperr
1906
George L. Balgue
